it.uniroma2.sel.simlab.jeqn.routers.policies.routing

Class NumericSequenceBasedRoutingPolicy

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.uniroma2.sel.simlab.jeqn.policies.ImplicitButNotExplicitInputOnlyDependentPolicy<it.uniroma2.sel.simlab.jrand.objectStreams.numericStreams.IntegerStream,java.lang.Integer>
      • it.uniroma2.sel.simlab.jeqn.routers.policies.routing.NumericSequenceBasedRoutingPolicy
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ImplicitButNotExplicitPolicy<it.uniroma2.sel.simlab.jrand.objectStreams.numericStreams.IntegerStream,java.lang.Integer>, ImplicitInputPolicy<it.uniroma2.sel.simlab.jrand.objectStreams.numericStreams.IntegerStream>, InputPolicy, Policy

    public class NumericSequenceBasedRoutingPolicy
extends ImplicitButNotExplicitInputOnlyDependentPolicy<it.uniroma2.sel.simlab.jrand.objectStreams.numericStreams.IntegerStream,java.lang.Integer>
    Implements a routing policy that relies on an internal sequence of number to determine the output port. This class might be useful in testing environments, in which the routing might be constrained to reproduce particular scenarios.
    Author:
    Daniele Gianni
